meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being linear.
meanings.sent1: The linearity of the ruler made it easy to draw a straight line.
meanings.sent2: The linearity of the plot made it simple to understand the story.
meanings.sent3: The linearity of the maze made it surprisingly easy to navigate.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts followed a path of linearity, each idea neatly connected to the next.
meanings.sent5: The linearity of the equation helped the students grasp the concept quickly.

meanings.definition: The property of a mathematical relationship or function that can be graphically represented as a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The linearity of the graph showed a clear relationship between the variables.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the linearity of the data made it easier to predict future outcomes.
meanings.sent3: The linearity of the function made it look like a simple line dance.
meanings.sent4: The linearity of the model made it a powerful tool for analysis.
meanings.sent5: The linearity of the chart made it easy to see the trend over time.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being arranged in a straight line or lines.
meanings.sent1: The linearity of the books on the shelf made them easy to find.
meanings.sent2: The linearity of the trees along the path created a sense of order.
meanings.sent3: The linearity of the ants marching in a row was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The linearity of the buildings in the city skyline gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent5: The linearity of the rows in the field made for efficient harvesting.
